About me

I'm currently a PhD student at UC Berkeley, researching mathematics relevant to AI safety under Stuart Russell.

I did my undergrad at the Australian National University, studying the theory of reinforcement learning and theoretical physics. I did my honours under Marcus Hutter; you can read my thesis "Resource-bounded Complexity-based Priors for Agents" here.

I'm interested in effective altruism. I care about nonhuman animals and I'm vegan.

I used to run the Less Wrong Canberra meetup, and am proud to be a founding member of People for the Ethical Treatment of Reinforcement Learners.

Feel free to read some recipes for meals that I enjoy, or have a look at my effective altruist profile.
